thread.title: Second GCC Games: Golden hat-trick for Issa al Adawi
thread.title_full: Second GCC Games: Golden hat-trick for Issa al Adawi

author: muscatdaily@apexmedia.co.om (Muscat Daily News)
title: Second GCC Games: Golden hat-trick for Issa al Adawi
text:
Second GCC Games: Golden hat-trick for Issa al Adawi Muscat Daily staff writer October 22, 2015 
Issa al Adawi, Oman's No 1 swimmer, established his credentials as the best in the region on Tuesday when he won two more gold medals to complete a golden hat-trick at the second GCC Games in Dammam, Saudi Arabia. 
Issa, who had won the 400m freestyle on Monday, continued from where he left, winning the 800m freestyle event in the morning session in a time of eight minutes, 59.07 seconds. 
He then capped off his spectacular performance with his third title, winning the 200m freestyle event in a time of 1m56.97s. 
Tuesday turned out to be the most successful day for the sultanate as Oman's 4x100m swimming quartet bagged a bronze in a time of 4m16.71s and national karate players picked up four bronze to take the overall medals haul to 22. With three gold, ten silver and nine bronze medals, Oman climbed to third place in the standings. 
Aiman al Kulaibi missed a medal as he finished fourth in the 200m backstroke and Nidhal al Harassi came sixth in the 100m butterfly event. 
Meanwhile, the national handball team lost its first match in the tournament, going down to Bahrain 28-29 in a thriller. Despite the loss, Oman is in contention for a medal, needing a win in its final league match against Saudi Arabia on Thursday. 
The Omani team officials complained of refereeing decisions going against them in the Bahrain match. 
Saudi Arabia and Bahrain have six points each, while Oman has four with a round to spare. Similar content
